PID Kp constant
PID Ki constant

inner bound of PID I summing cutoff

detaileddescription.para: initialize pid structure, set parameters based on another PID structure

PID instance to copy settings from
instance of PID structure

memberdef.name: pidCalculateWithVelocitySet

detaileddescription.para: calculate PID output while velocity control is active. The velocity set point will be subtracted from the time derivative of the error

parameterdescription.para: the PID controller to use for the calculation
the set point of the system
the value of the feedback sensor in the system
the velocity set point of the system

simplesect.para: the output value of the control loop

detaileddescription.para: calculate PID output for velocity control using feedforward instead of an error calculation, but still allowing for I and D components.

parameterdescription.para: the PID controller to use for the calculation
the set point of the system
the value of the feedback sensor in the system

detaileddescription.para: return a pointer to a ROBOTC sensor

simplesect.para: the pointer to the sensor value

memberdef.argsstring: (int motorPort, int *sensor, int vMax, float Ka, int t1, int t2, int cycleTime, int positionCycles)
memberdef.name: createMotionProfile

detaileddescription.para: create a motion profile for a motor/sensor pair. PID controllers for the motion profile will be set to default with 0 feedback control and a neutral feedforward gain of 127.0/vMax

parameterdescription.para: the motor port to create a profile for
a pointer to the sensor value to monitor. This can be a pointer to any integer, or a "raw" sensor value using getRawSensor().
the maximum velocity to use when calculating moves
acceleration constant used when ramping up/down velocity during moves
time to spend at peak acceleration at the beginning/end of a move. This and t2 will determine the shape of the motion curve
time to spend at peak jerk (time derivative of acceleration) at the beginning/end of acceleration. Time to get from 0 to max velocity (or max to 0) = t1 + 2*t2

polling rate/sample period of system. Polling frequency = 1000/cycleTime. Note that ports 2-9 on cortex only can update at a frequency of 18.5Hz, so values less than ~20 here will offer diminishing returns.
cycles to skip for position updates during moves. This will generally be 3-5

detaileddescription.para: create a motion profile for a motor/sensor pair using default timing settings and a Ka of 0. This will provide simple feedforward position/velocity control

parameterdescription.para: the motor port to create a profile for
a pointer to the sensor value to monitor. This can be a pointer to any integer, or a "raw" sensor value using getRawSensor().
the maximum velocity to use when calculating moves

memberdef.argsstring: (int motorPort, float Kp, float Ki, float Kd, float innerBand, float outerBand)
memberdef.name: setPositionController

detaileddescription.para: set the position PID controller for the specified motor's motion profile

parameterdescription.para: the motor to update
proportional gain
integral gain
derivative gain
the inner integral deadBand value
the outer integral deadBand value

memberdef.argsstring: (int motorPort, float Kp, float Ki, float Kd, float innerBand, float outerBand)
memberdef.name: setVelocityController

detaileddescription.para: set the velocity PID controller for the specified motor's motion profile

parameterdescription.para: the motor to update
proportional gain
integral gain
derivative gain
the inner integral deadBand value
the outer integral deadBand value

detaileddescription.para: set a motor to copy another motor's motion profile and mirror its output value

parameterdescription.para: the motor to have mirror another motor
the motor to mirror

detaileddescription.para: issue a move command to the specified position. This will currently do nothing if the move is considered to be a "short move", ie. the motor is unable to fully ramp up to max velocity during the move. Note that this is an absolute position command, so two consecutive moves to 4000 are not equivalent to a single move to 8000.

parameterdescription.para: the motor to issue the move command to
the position to move to

detaileddescription.para: set a motor's output to a value from -127 to 127

parameterdescription.para: the motor to set the output value of
output value to set

detaileddescription.para: set a motor's velocity to the specified value

parameterdescription.para: the motor to set
desired velocity
